Like I said; the older generations are extremely socially conservative and Japan has a lot of old people.  In a decade or so they'll become geeky, but it's going to take some time until otaku culture gains acceptance.

topics.body:
"@SeraphimDawn":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a390356368720bea031800#post_54a390356368720bea031800
Pretty much.

I know it's pretty fucking dark and I know I keep going back to this, but look at it as the main reason why say gay marriage is gaining acceptance so fast in the USA; the generations that overwhelmingly oppose it are dying of old age whereas the younger generations are massively for acceptance.  It's a metaphorical same scenario in Japan; anti-geeks and social conservatives are getting pretty damn old whereas geeks and social liberals consist of the younger generations.
